item.title: WARRIORS: Abyss second major update now available, adds Atelier series heroines Sophie, Ryza, and Yumia
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/warriors-abyss-second-major-update-now-available-adds-atelier-series-heroines-sophie-ryza-and-yumia

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Plus new music tracks and various other features and improvements.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Omega Force have released the second major update for roguelike action game WARRIORS: Abyss, which adds Atelier series heroines Sophie, Ryza, and Yumia as playable characters.

Here are the full patch notes:

New Features

  • New heroes Sophie, Ryza, and Yumia have been added to the game!
  • Seven tracks have been added to Music in the Collection, all unlocked from the start.
  • We have added a Download Content option to the Great Hall. Update information can be viewed from the pause menu.
  • At the War Banner of the King where you select heroes for your formation, a boost icon now displays to show which heroes are affected by the currently selected hero’s Unique Tactics.
    • The boost icon displays yellow for heroes who activate the Unique Tactic and gray for those who do not.
    • For example, if your current selection is a hero with the Unique Tactic “Increases Attack by 50% for heroes with the “Wei” Emblem,” the boost icon will display for heroes with the Wei Emblem.
  • We have adjusted the hero display order in the Hero List tab of the Status Menu. Also, it now shows the slot number of heroes in your Formation.
  • We have adjusted the order of Effect Upgrades and Unique Tactics in the Activation Effects tab of the Status Menu. In addition, slot numbers will now be displayed for the Unique Tactics of heroes in your current Formation.
  • You can now check information on heroes you added to your Formation from the Formation tab in the Status Menu.
  • At the War Banner of the King, we have added an option to revert to the previous Formation after selecting “Enma’s Recommended Formation.”
  • You can now display hero descriptions on the “Select Hero to Play”screen.
  • Steam-Specific
    • We have added an option allowing players to select their preferred output monitor. This setting can be changed under Graphics Settings in the Options menu.

Adjustments / Improvements

  • After using a Crystal Sapling, you can interact with it again if you possess Crystal Beads.
  • A treasure chest icon now displays in the top right of the screen in phases where missions appear.
  • Music in the Collection now displays the name of the track that is playing.
  • When acquiring treasure, you will now see a checkmark displayed by any treasures you have acquired in the past.
  • We have adjusted the hero display order in the Play Records screen.
  • On the Effect Upgrades screen, the cursor now loops when moved to the top or bottom.
  • The effects of the following treasures have been increased:
    • Cherry Blossom Armor
    • Bow of Yang Youji
    • Ranjatai Agarwood
    • Kompeito
    • Compass
    • Four-Wheeled Chariot
    • Painting of Kannon
    • Abacus
    • Bronze Bird
  • We have increased the amount of extra Karma Embers acquired when playing as a hero in the Bonus State.
  • Formations you have not yet unlocked at the Hall of Bonded Souls will appear at the King’s Cauldrons in an unpurchasable condition.
  • Formations you have unlocked at the Hall of Bonded Souls now appear in treasure chests as rewards for completing missions.
  • At Traversal Level 3 and above, Danger Zones now include Sin Spewers, whose projectiles cannot be destroyed with attacks.
  • Level boss “Onigashira” now has a smaller barrier gauge.
  • Hitting a level boss with a Charge Attack while they are glowing yellow now deals damage to their barrier.
  • We have increased the chance of acquiring a Unique Weapon from treasure chests.
  • We have adjusted the way Enma’s Recommended Formation is calculated.
  • We have adjusted the visual effects of Xu Shu and Motonari Mori’s summoning skills.
  • We have adjusted the screen shake during Cao Ren’s Charge Attack 1.
  • You can now unleash a Musou Attack during the following attacks:
    • Lu Meng’s Charge Attack 2
    • Taishi Ci’s Charge Attack 2 (2nd hit)
    • Oichi’s Charge Attack 2 (3rd hit)
    • Tadakatsu Honda’s Charge Attack 2 (2nd hit) and Charge Attack 3 (2nd hit)
    • No’s Charge Attack 5 (2nd hit)
    • Ina’s Hyper Attack (derivation 6)
    • Kanetsugu Naoe’s Charge Attack 2
    • Nene’s Charge Attack 2 (2nd hit)
    • Kiyomasa Kato’s Charge Attack 2 (3rd hit)
    • Naomasa Ii’s Charge Attack 2 (2nd hit)
  • We have reduced the degree to which the following effects contribute to Total Battle Power:
    • Musou Gauge Charge Amount
    • Musou Attack Power Increase
    • Assemble Gauge Charge Amount
    • Normal Attacks with Attributes
    • Attack power of Charge Attacks
  • We have also fixed a bug that prevents you from selecting a Formation when you use “Enma’s Recommended Formation” while Total Battle Power exceeds the display limit.
  • Under Audio in the Options menu, we have moved the enemy voice category from “Voice Volume” to “SFX Volume.”
    • We have also made it possible to set louder volumes for “Voice Volume,” “SFX Volume” and “BGM Volume.” The default volume for these three settings is now set to 80.
    • If you feel the background music is too quiet during gameplay, try raising BGM Volume and lowering Voice Volume and SFX Volume.
  • Nintendo Switch-Specific
    • We have improved the performance of the Nintendo Switch version.
    • We have made adjustments to the overall color scheme.

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug where the application would occasionally crash when playing as Chen Gong.
  • Fixed an effect bug that would occur when using Sima Yi’s Unique Weapon.
  • Fixed the behavior of attacks that diverge from the first part of Kunoichi’s Hyper Attack.
  • Fixed an issue where the extra damage caused to enemies knocked into the air by Zhang Liao’s Unique Weapon was not of the Bolt Attribute as intended.
  • Fixed a bug where summoning slot 6 could be used while Lu Lingqi is using Assemble attack.
  • Fixed an occasional bug where enemies would enter a formation set up with Xun Yu’s Unique Action but take no damage from the attack that causes it to explode after a certain period.
  • Fixed a bug where it was possible to use Ma Chao’s Charge 5 EX Attack before acquiring the effect “Unlock Attack Actions 3.”
  • Fixed a bug where performing a Quick Summon while floating with Wang Yuanji’s Charge Attack 4 would stop this action.
  • Fixed a bug where the spheres of the Protective Star effect would temporarily show up overlapping.
  • Fixed a bug where the Protective Star effect would not follow some of the player hero’s actions.
  • Fixed a bug where Cumulative Level would rise by 1 upon return to the Great Hall, despite having never levelled up once in battle.
  • Fixed a bug that occasionally did not display information on top of enemies’ head.
  • Fixed an error in the effect description of Sima Yi’s Unique Weapon in English, French, Italian, German and Spanish.
  • Removed an unnecessary part of the Korean description of Liu Bei’s Unique Weapon traits.
  • Changed the French term for the special emblem “Talent” to “Aptitude.”
  • Made various other minor bug fixes and improvements.
  • Nintendo Switch-Specific
    • Fixed a bug that occasionally caused the screen to turn a strange color during Assemble.
    • Fixed a bug where playtime would still be counted while the device was in sleep mode.
  • Steam-Specific
    • Fixed a bug that occasionally prevented the game from showing up on the main display when launching the application.

WARRIORS: Abyss is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: The Exit 8 now available for iOS, Android
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/the-exit-8-now-available-for-ios-android

  • Smartphone

Play the anomaly-spotting walking simulator on the go.

The Exit 8 is now available for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play for $3.99, publisher PLAYISM and developer KOTAKE CREATE announced.

The anomaly-spotting walking simulator, which has sold 1.4 million copies, has previously been released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via App Store:

You are trapped in an endless underground passageway. Observe your surroundings carefully to reach “The Exit 8.”

Don’t overlook any anomalies. If you find anomalies, turn back immediately. If you don’t find anomalies, do not turn back. To go out from Exit 8.

The Exit 8 is a short walking simulator inspired by Japanese underground passageways, liminal spaces and back rooms.

item.title: Maid Cafe on Electric Street second major update now available, adds The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center collaborations
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/maid-cafe-on-electric-street-second-major-update-now-available-adds-the-exit-8-and-urban-myth-dissolution-center-collaborations

  • PC

Experience an "anomaly" in a certain place.

Publisher PLAYISM and developer Adventurer’s Tavern have released the second major update for “leisurely maid cafe adventure” game Maid Cafe on Electric Street, which adds a new content in collaboration with KOTAKE CREATE‘s The Exit 8 and Hakaba Bunko‘s Urban Myth Dissolution Center.

Here are the details:

Collaborations with The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center!

Maid Cafe on Electric Street is collaborating with The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center, adding new side content to the game!

For The Exit 8, other than in-game collectibles such as a physical edition of the game or a tapestry, you might be able to experience an “anomaly” in a certain place once you fulfill certain requirements…! More in-game content for Urban Myth Dissolution Center is in the works as well, so please stay tuned!

Steam Trading Cards

Alongside the collabs, Maid Cafe on Electric Street now also supports Steam trading cards! Now you can collect trading cards, emojis, badges, and profile backgrounds, as well as Point Shop-exclusive items. Whether you’ve played the game inside-out or have just started your first playthrough, you can now work towards a cool Steam collection as well!

20 Percent-Off Sale

To celebrate this major update, Maid Cafe on Electric Street is on sale for 20 percent-off on Steam, so this is the perfect time to purchase the game if you haven’t already!

What’s more, a collaborative Steam bundle with Urban Myth Dissolution Center is also now available. This allows you to grab both games at a discount, or get an even bigger discount on one of the games if you already own the other!

Maid Cafe on Electric Street is available now for PC via Steam. Console versions are currently in development.

item.title: Nintendo Today! app announced for iOS, Android, now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/nintendo-today-app-announced-for-ios-android-now-available

  • Smartphone

Daily updates from Nintendo.

Nintendo has announced Nintendo Today!, a free app to deliver daily updates from Nintendo. It is available for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play.

Here is an overview of the app, via Nintendo:

Nintendo Fun, Delivered Daily!

Nintendo Today! is an app for your smart device that brings you daily updates from Nintendo based on what you like. Anyone with a Nintendo Account and compatible smart device can use this free app.

  • Daily Updates – Get updates on all things Nintendo! Whether it’s news about the Nintendo Switch 2 system and video games, info about your favorite characters, or videos and comic strips—you’ll get personalized fun every day.
  • Animated Calendar – Keep track of the date with an animated calendar! Choose from themes featuring Super Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Animal Crossing, and more.
  • Event Schedule – Plan ahead for Nintendo Direct presentations, game releases, in-game events, and more with this handy schedule. You can display events based on categories or games, like to show events related to the game you are playing.
  • Customize Your Home Screen – Set up a widget to view the calendar and content from your home screen. You can even customize your widget with art from your favorite Nintendo game series from select franchises—try using a themed wallpaper to match!
